hook: The betting market treats the 49ers quarterback as a constant, but the data reveals he is a variable entirely dependent on one specific condition: pocket integrity.

sections.title: The Tale of Two Quarterbacks
key_points: Contrast the 'Clean Pocket' MVP candidate with the 'Under Pressure' liability.
Establish the 'Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde' nature of his performance.
Introduce the core metric: Passer Rating Differential.
stats_facts: Clean Pocket Passer Rating: 112.4 (Rank #3 in NFL).
Under Pressure Passer Rating: 64.2 (Rank #24 in NFL).
"The drop-off isn't a slope; it's a cliff."
sections.transition: This statistical cliff wouldn't matter if he were facing a mediocre pass rush, but he is walking into a buzzsaw.

sections.title: The Opponent's Pressure Profile
key_points: Analyze the opponent's ability to generate pressure.
Explain why this specific matchup is the worst-case scenario for the 49ers.
stats_facts: Opponent Defense Pressure Rate: 34.1% (Rank #4 in NFL).
They generate pressure without blitzing on 28% of dropbacks.
sections.transition: The common narrative is that he gets the ball out fast enough to negate this rush, but the timing metrics tell a different story.

sections.title: The Timing Mismatch
key_points: Compare 'Time to Throw' vs 'Time to Pressure'.
Explain why the internal clock won't save him this Sunday.
stats_facts: Opponent Average Time to Pressure: 2.48 seconds.
sections.transition: When the timing fails and the pocket collapses, the decision-making crumbles with it.

sections.title: The Turnover Trap
key_points: Discuss the 'Max Protect' fallacy (fewer receivers = tighter windows).
stats_facts: 75% of his interceptions this season occurred when the pocket was collapsed.
sections.transition: This volatility creates a massive edge in the prop betting market that the books haven't fully adjusted for.

sections.title: The Betting Edge
key_points: Synthesize the data into actionable bets.
Focus on 'Under Passing Yards' and 'Interception Props'.
Final verdict on the risk profile.
stats_facts: If pressure rate > 30%, the 'Under Passing Yards' hits at an 80% clip.
Value on 'Over 0.5 Interceptions' and 'Under Passing Yards'.
sections.transition: Don't bet on the player; bet on the pressure.
